## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've got a couple of questions about using Verus commands. How do I use the `listidentities` command to get a list of all identities on the blockchain?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, you can't use the `listidentities` command to get a list of all identities on the blockchain. The `listidentities` command requires a filter, such as `{"name" : "myname"}`, to specify which identities to retrieve. Without a filter, it won't return all identities on the blockchain.

**User:**
Okay, that makes sense. What about the `recoveridentity` command? Can I use that to create a new identity?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the `recoveridentity` command is used to recover a revoked identity, not to create a new one. Its purpose is to restore an identity that has been revoked, not to create a new identity from scratch.
How do I use the `listidentities` command to get a list of all identities on the blockchain?

You can't use the `listidentities` command to get a list of all identities on the blockchain. The `listidentities` command requires a filter, such as `{"name" : "myname"}`, to specify which identities to retrieve. Without a filter, it won't return all identities on the blockchain.

(text) i-address of the ID
   "parent": "xxxx",        (text) Parent ID of the chain the ID is on
   "name": "xxxx",         (text) The Identity Name
   "contentmap": {
   },
   "revocationauthority": "xxxx", (text) the i-address of the identity that can revoke this ID
   "recoveryauthority": "xxxx",  (text) the i-address of the identity that can recover this ID when revoked
   "timelock": 0          (integer) Timelock
  },
  "blockheight": n,         (integer) blockheight the current ID info was put on the chain
  "txid": "xxxx",          (string) Transaction ID at blockheight to put the current ID data on the chain
  "status": "xxxx",         (text) The revocation status ("Active"|"Revoked")
  "canspendfor": xxxx,       (boolean) Can the node running the command spend UTXOs on this ID (True|False)
  "cansignfor": xxxx,        (boolean) Can the node running the command sign for this ID (True|False)
 },
 ....
]
 ```
Examples:
```bash
> verus listidentities '{"name" : "myname"}'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listidentities", "params": ['{"name" : "myname"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
### `recoveridentity "jsonidentity" (returntx) (tokenrecover) (feeoffer) (sourceoffunds)`
#### Arguments:
```
    "returntx"            (bool,  optional) defaults to false and transaction is sent, if true, transaction is signed by this wallet and returned
    "tokenrevoke"           (bool,  optional) defaults to false, if true, the tokenized ID control token, if one exists, will be used to revoke
    "feeoffer"            (value, optional) non-standard fee amount to pay for the transaction
    "sourceoffunds"          (string, optional) tr
Can I use the `recoveridentity` command to create a new identity?

No, the `recoveridentity` command is used to recover a revoked identity, not to create a new one. Its purpose is to restore an identity that has been revoked, not to create a new identity from scratch.

    "feeoffer"            (value, optional) non-standard fee amount to pay for the transaction
